item.title: Practices for a Missional Church Planting Order
item.description:
Practices for a Missional Church Planting Order

What practices can sustain missional practice and spiritual vitality among church planters?

item.title: Is Missional Good for Us?
item.description:
Is Missional Good for Us?

For those who sense that "being missional" is just another Christian guilt trip.

item.title: The Future Of Religion? A Researcher Looks To Seattle For Clues
item.description:
The Future Of Religion? A Researcher Looks To Seattle For Clues

Marcie Sillman talks with Chris James of Dubuque University about his study on Seattle churches and what they can tell us about the future of religion.

item.title: Missional Mapmaking by Alan Roxburgh (Review)
item.description:
Missional Mapmaking by Alan Roxburgh (Review)

My Review of Alan Roxburgh's Missional Mapmaking: Skills for Leading in Times of Transition. Originally Published in Witness Journal.

item.title: Ecclesial Pioneers in the Pacific Northwest
item.description:
Ecclesial Pioneers in the Pacific Northwest

The Pacific Northwest is one of the most fertile seedbeds for religious innovation and creativity in North America.

item.title: Newbigin's Gospel in a Pluralist Society
item.description:
Newbigin's Gospel in a Pluralist Society

A while back I was invited to speak to a group called Theology on Tap about "The Gospel in a Post-Christian World. The topic, it seemed to me, begged two questions. The first is “What is the gospel?” and the second is “Where are we? What is this post-Christian world in which we live?”

item.title: Christopher B. James on Academia.edu
item.description:
Christopher B. James on Academia.edu

Selected Articles on Missional Praxis, Spiritual Formation, and Congregational Studies.

item.title: 'Some Fell on Good Soil': Church Planting in Religious Ecologies
item.description:
'Some Fell on Good Soil': Church Planting in Religious Ecologies

In the midst of the decline of mainline denominations and the rise of the "nones" in the U.S. something surprising is happening. Church planting is booming.

item.title: Perspectives on Ecclesiology & Ethnography (Review)
item.description:
Perspectives on Ecclesiology & Ethnography (Review)

My review of Perspectives on Ecclesiology and Ethnography edited by Pete Ward. Originally published in Missiology: An International Review.
